creditline: Gift of John and Laura Taft
description: black ink on off-white paper; large area of water in lower area of image; small boat/canoe with people on it in center (?); large dark area of trees on each side of water in upper area of image; short bank with bushes on left side; trees reflected in water; in background, sketched outline of mountains with trees and one small chimney/rectangular building near center; sky and water are tinted grey; sky has thin flowing horizontal lines; short bank below trees on right
provenance: Robert Taft (1889-1953, Cincinnati and Washington, D.C.); by descent to John Taft, Minneapolis; given to MIA, 2018.
signed: LRC in plate: Seymour Haden | LLC in pencil: Seymour Haden | in LRC in plate: 1864
text: This vertical landscape came into being as the result of an accident that marred a larger horizontal composition. Haden cut the copper plate and continued to work on the left-hand piece. What had been the periphery now became the center. He created a bit of drama by elaborating the densely wooded riverbanks, allowing them to set off the distant hillside view.
title: Evening
